text: [Music]
hello I'm Georgia Technical Support
associate here at the aw's office in
Cape Town today I'm going to explain how
Amazon ec2 hours are built let's get
started ec2 instance are built either by
the full hour or per second depending on
the instant size operating system and
the AWS reason where the in inst Es are
launched and building continues as long
as the instance is in a running state
from the aw's console go to the bilding
and cost
Management in the left pane click on
build scroll down and expand elastic
compute
Cloud for instances that are Bild by the
hour you are charged for minimum of 1
hour each time and new instance starts
this charge applies to all instance
start except Linux windows and windows
with SQL Enterprise SQL standard or SQL
web instances for instances that are
built by the second you are charged for
minimum of 60 seconds each time a new
instance starts this charge applies to
Linux windows and windows with ESL ESL
standard or ESL web
instances note that an instance remains
in a running State while it's rebooted
so you continue to recuit charges during
reboots if your instance is stopped and
then started the AWS accounting
mechanism charges more units in an hour
that the instance is stopped and
started you then build fewer units in
the hour the instance is terminated so
that your overall building remains
unaffected instances that are in any
other state besides running or in build
if you have reserved instances for
savings plans then the pricing is
modified based on the terms of those
contracts thanks for watching and happy
count competing from all of us at AWS
[Music]
